basics.name: Ben Lorantfy
basics.summary:
- 4+ years of professional software development  
- 7+ years of freelance JavaScript development 
- Extensive experience in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, React, nodejs, and others  
- Experience creating several production-grade web sites and applications

work.summary: - Own and operate Lorantfy Dev and Design, a software development consultancy specializing in JavaScript.

- Oversaw and contributed to front-end development of highly depended on web applications, using react, redux, and other technologies.  
 - Worked closely with product and design teams to create responsive, accessible, well-tested, and performant user experiences.  
  - Maintained frontend infrastructure including webpack, babel, jest, eslint, and other tools  
  - Also worked on back-end services and deploy pipelines using node.js, docker, AWS, ECS, CircleCI, and other technologies
highlights: Helped start initiative to meet WCAG Level AA compliance while also increasing general a11y awareness. For example, by setting up automated tools, checking for a11y issues during code reviews, and other measures
Created and maintained an internal component library for use across projects
Initiated and oversaw long-term technical initiatives, including migrating a project to typescript, upgrading from react 15 to react 16, and others

work.summary:
- Worked closely with product and design teams to create responsive, accessible, well-tested, and performant user experiences.  
- Worked in an agile environment, participating in grooming and planning sessions
highlights: Helped create an internal ordering system that reliably handles hundreds of orders a day
Helped create an advertising analytics platform, providing insights for sales people and a few thousand Postmedia clients

work.summary: - Wrote JavaScript code for a PhoneGap mobile application
highlights: Helped create a new version of our flagship product in a new technology

work.summary:
- Wrote front-end and back-end code for several web applications to improve production processes  
- Performed requirement gathering, project management, server administration, and testing
highlights: Created a quality assurance tracking system from start to finish. System was used on the shop floor to submit and track car part testing. Production managers noticed substantial efficiency and communication benefits

work.summary: I have years of part-time experience working on freelance development projects including websites and mobile apps

awards.title: Conestoga Co-Op Student of the Year Award
awards.summary: I was awarded a Conestoga Co-Op Student of the Year Award in 2015 for my Co-Op work at Brose Canada Inc. where I developed several web applications to help them optimize their production processes. This is a prestigious award that is given to students who demonstrate significant job achievement, academic achievement, and extracurricular involvement in the school and/or community.

awards.title: Skills Canada Web Development Gold Medal
awards.summary: I was awarded the Skills Canada Web Development Gold Medal in 2015 for my proficiency in front-end and back-end web development at the Skills Canada 2015 competition in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. I had advanced through the college competition and a provincial competition before winning nationally. Skills Canada is a respected organization that organizes a national event each year in a rotating province with hundreds of competitions in various skill trade fields.
